tournament.name: Main Event - Eternal Weekend Europe 2024 (J.K. Entertainment GmbH)

decks.notes: The main concept of this Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Dredge deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp, Golgari Thug, and Narcomoeba, in order to trigger powerful effects such as Prized Amalgam and Creeping Chill and overwhelm the opponent with a rush of creatures. The deck utilizes cards like Bazaar of Baghdad to accelerate the dredge process, while also packing disruption like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its combo pieces and control the game. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Chalice of the Void and Mental Misstep for further disruption and protection.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Psychic Frog and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also features key mana acceleration with powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Mox Sapphire, Jet, and Pearl to help cast the high-cost spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through card advantage and resource denial while gradually gaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies by utilizing hatebears like Archon of Emeria, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Chancellor of the Annex, and Anointed Peacekeeper to slow down their spells and mana development. The aggro element comes from creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Witch Enchanter, while also employing mana acceleration in the form of Elvish Spirit Guide and fast mana artifacts like Chrome Mox and Lotus Petal. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to further hinder opponents' game plans. The mana base is optimized for fast, aggressive starts while also providing disruption with cards like Karakas and Wasteland.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful disruptive spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to control the game. It also includes versatile cards like Brainstorm and Demonic Tutor to find answers to threats. The deck leverages its graveyard with cards like Dig Through Time and Treasure Cruise to maintain card advantage. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion to provide additional value by recurring low-cost permanents. With efficient removal like Fatal Push and strong finishers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, this deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol its opponents in the Vintage format.

The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo as quickly and efficiently as possible, using a combination of card draw, disruption, and mana acceleration to set up a win with Thassa's Oracle. It includes a variety of cantrips and tutors to find the necessary pieces, along with counterspells and disruption to protect the combo. The deck is built to be able to win in a single turn, pulling off a powerful combo finish that can catch opponents off guard. It aims to be fast and resilient, with multiple ways to find and execute the win condition.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures that also have disruptive abilities to slow down opponents. By combining hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex with powerful spells like Swords to Plowshares and March of Otherworldly Light, the deck aims to control the game while applying pressure to the opponent. The inclusion of powerful mana acceleration like Black Lotus and Moxen allows for fast starts and explosive plays. With a mix of disruption, aggression, and mana acceleration, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and dictate the pace of the game.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through cards like Grim Monolith and Coveted Jewel, while utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and replay artifacts for a combo finish. The key strategy is to efficiently ramp up mana production and combo off using Paradox Engine and Time Vault with support from cards like Manifold Key and Voltaic Key. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to control the game until the combo can be assembled for a win.

This deck combines aggressive creatures with disruptive spells to control the game and apply pressure on the opponent. By utilizing a combination of efficient threats like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Psychic Frog, along with disruption like Force of Will and Fatal Push, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence. Additionally, the deck includes powerful cards like Blightsteel Colossus and Tinker to quickly close out the game. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility in casting spells across different colors.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal, and disruptive cards to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It utilizes powerful spells like Ancestral Recall, Timetwister, and Time Walk to gain card advantage and tempo. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value from the graveyard. The deck also uses cheap cantrips and mana rocks to draw cards and accelerate its game plan. It aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent while maintaining control of the game.

The focus of this Vintage Dredge deck is to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp, Narcomoeba, and Golgari Thug, allowing for powerful graveyard-based synergy with cards like Prized Amalgam and Ichorid. The deck aims to quickly reanimate creatures like Hollow One and Grief, while also utilizing cards like Creeping Chill for additional value. The deck also includes various counterspells and disruption spells to protect the combo and interact with the opponent, along with the powerful card-draw engine Bazaar of Baghdad to help dig for combo pieces.

The deck focuses on using the Oath of Druids card to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn early in the game. It also includes a suite of counterspells like Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. Additionally, the deck features card draw and selection spells such as Ancestral Recall, Brainstorm, and Ponder to find the combo pieces quickly. The inclusion of disruptive planeswalkers like Narset, Parter of Veils and Oko, Thief of Crowns adds another layer of control to the deck, making it difficult for opponents to disrupt the game plan.

The deck focuses on assembling powerful artifacts using cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker to generate massive card advantage and mana acceleration. The deck aims to establish a board presence quickly with fast mana like Mana Crypt and Grim Monolith, while using cards like Phyrexian Metamorph and Mystic Forge to generate additional value. The inclusion of powerful artifact interactions like Time Vault and Voltaic Key allow for potential infinite turns, while disruptive cards like Force of Will and Trinisphere help control the opponent's game plan. It's a high-powered combo deck that can quickly overwhelm opponents with its synergistic artifacts.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. It includes cards like Dark Ritual, Demonic Tutor, and Force of Will to help set up the combo and protect it from disruption. The deck also includes card draw spells like Ponder and Preordain to help dig for combo pieces. The goal is to use Doomsday to set up a winning pile of cards, then play Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the same turn. The deck also includes some disruption in the form of Flusterstorm and Force of Negation to help protect the combo.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by utilizing cards like Null Rod, Blood Moon, and Magus of the Moon to disrupt opponents' mana bases and prevent them from casting spells effectively. The deck also includes aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers to pressure opponents and win the game quickly. Additionally, the deck has access to powerful red removal spells like Fury and Sundering Eruption to deal with threats on the board. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive in disrupting the opponent while presenting a fast clock to win the game.

The deck centers around utilizing fast and efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan. By combining aggressive creatures like Boggart Trawler and Troll of Khazad-dûm with disruptive cards like Grief, Opposition Agent, and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to control the game from the beginning and overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and graveyard disruption cards like Dauthi Voidwalker to further disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain its aggressive tempo.

The deck focuses on using Paradoxical Outcome to generate a lot of value by returning multiple artifacts to your hand and drawing cards. This allows you to chain spells together and generate a lot of mana with artifacts like Mox Opal and Mana Crypt. The goal is to assemble the Time Vault and Manifold Key combo to take extra turns and win the game. The deck includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and interaction with the opponent's board through cards like Swords to Plowshares. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient in Vintage 1 vs 1 gameplay.

The deck focuses on assembling powerful storm combos using spells like Brainstorm, Vampiric Tutor, and Yawgmoth's Will to generate massive amounts of mana and card advantage. By chaining together cards like Dark Ritual, Demonic Tutor, and Tendrils of Agony, the goal is to cast a high storm count spell to deal lethal damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck's mana acceleration from Moxen and Black Lotus allows for explosive plays, while disruptive cards like Force of Will and Pyroblast protect the combo from opposing disruption.

The deck focuses on using the Doomsday combo to stack the top of the library with Thassa's Oracle, then winning the game on the next turn by drawing a card with an empty library. It includes powerful card selection tools like Ponder and Brainstorm, along with disruption and protection from Force of Will and Flusterstorm. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces while also disrupting opponents' strategies, utilizing powerful tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to find key cards. It emphasizes speed, efficiency, and precision to win as quickly as possible.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of control elements like counterspells and removals to disrupt opponent's strategies while generating card advantage through card draw and manipulation. The inclusion of Lurrus as a companion offers a valuable recur ability for low-cost permanents. The deck also capitalizes on synergy between cards like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog to control the board efficiently. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to all three colors, while the powerful spells like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Demonic Tutor provide additional options for dominating the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through disruption, card advantage, and removal spells. It utilizes powerful spells like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Demonic Tutor to gain an advantage. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides a companion option and allows for recursion of key cards. The deck also includes a mix of counterspells, creature removal, and card draw to keep opponents off balance. The mana base is optimized to support the three-color Esper Control deck, with lands like Underground Sea and Tundra providing the necessary colors to cast spells efficiently.

The deck aims to control the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan through countering spells, removing threats, and drawing extra cards. It utilizes cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to control the board while also having powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The inclusion of a companion, Lurrus of the Dream-Den, allows for additional value by being able to reuse low-cost permanents from the graveyard. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and includes disruptive lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and powerful artifacts to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It includes powerful mana acceleration with artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen, as well as disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void, Null Rod, and Sphere of Resistance to slow down the opponent. It also has synergy with Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's lands. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Stonecoil Serpent while controlling the game with disruptive artifacts.

This deck utilizes a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive hate cards to slow down the opponent and prevent them from executing their game plan effectively. By playing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chalice of the Void, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plays while deploying its own threats to quickly close out the game. The deck also includes mana acceleration and land destruction to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. Its goal is to apply early pressure and maintain control of the game through disruptive tactics.

This deck focuses on playing hatebears and aggressive creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. The deck utilizes cards like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down the opponent, while also using efficient creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Seasoned Dungeoneer to close out the game quickly. By combining hate cards with aggressive threats, this deck aims to control the game and punish the opponent's strategy, leading to a powerful and disruptive playstyle in 1 vs 1 Vintage matches.

This deck focuses on using artifact creatures and disruptive artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent with early aggression. By utilizing mana acceleration and lockout effects such as Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing its own board presence. With the ability to recur key pieces like Crucible of Worlds and access to powerful cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator, this deck aims to establish control and pressure the opponent into submission.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal, while also utilizing the powerful Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while also ramping into big threats quickly with Show and Tell. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns adds additional control and disruption to the deck's game plan, making it a formidable force in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to quickly get powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield. The deck also includes a package of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to control the game and protect the combo. The inclusion of cards like Show and Tell and Tinker allows for additional ways to cheat out game-winning threats. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while setting up its own powerful creatures to dominate the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the opponent's board using counter spells and removal while using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play. The deck also utilizes Show and Tell to put big threats into play quickly. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition by quickly deploying threats. The inclusion of cards like Vexing Bauble, Boseiju, Who Endures, and Oko, Thief of Crowns provide additional disruption and value to the deck.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to generate a large amount of mana and draw cards through Paradoxical Outcome. By playing cards like Mana Crypt, Moxen, Voltaic Key, and Grim Monolith, the deck can quickly set up a win condition by comboing off with cards like Time Vault and The One Ring. Additionally, cards like Defense Grid and Force of Will are used to protect the combo and disrupt opponents' strategies. Mystic Forge and Coveted Jewel provide additional card advantage and mana acceleration, while Karn, the Great Creator can shut down opposing artifacts.

This deck aims to quickly generate mana and card advantage through artifacts to set up a powerful combo using Paradoxical Outcome. The goal is to bounce multiple artifacts back to hand, drawing cards and generating more mana in the process. This allows the player to dig deeper into their deck for key pieces like Time Vault and The One Ring to win the game quickly and decisively. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to control the game and protect the combo.

The deck focuses on using artifact cards and key combo pieces to generate powerful card advantage and disrupt the opponent's plans. It aims to generate mana quickly with cards like Grim Monolith and Moxen, while also utilizing cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Mystic Forge to draw through the deck and find key combo pieces like Time Vault and Tinker. With control elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor, along with the ability to tutor with Urza's Saga and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win through its powerful combo interactions.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful card Underworld Breach to create a combo that allows the player to cast multiple spells from their graveyard. By using card draw spells, tutors, and fast mana like Black Lotus and Moxen, the deck aims to quickly assemble a game-winning combination of spells, such as Brain Freeze or Ancestral Recall. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion ensures that the player can continuously recur important cards from their graveyard, providing resilience and consistency to the combo strategy.
